ygData.subject: Re: Oasis Warning
ygData.msgSnippet: ... it ... If you played Realm then you would know better then to even think for one minute that with Stephen involved in Middle Earth - it s not going to be
ygData.messageBody:
> From: "Azor" <jmaynus@...>
> Realm. The Realm at first was a big game, but over time ppl got tired of
it
> and they quit playing where is the Realm now? It might still be there but
> how often is it updated, how many ppl are on there now to play with or
> against? I like EQ about as much as the next person, but I have a feeling
> we won't see it around or as big as it is now for I'd say 2-3 more years,
> with games such as Middle-Earth, Asherions Call and I've heard of one more


If you played Realm then you would know better then to even think for one
minute that with Stephen involved in Middle Earth - it's not going to be
anything but a mess. I don't think he could program his way out of a paper
bag! And I for one will NEVER buy a game that he is involved in.
Been there, done that! lol

People left Realm to come here for the most part, Sierra is in trouble -
Middle Earth is not being worked on at this time and it will be years before
it comes out if ever. It would not surprise me to see somewhere down the
road that Sierra sells the rights to it.

Its the same with everything in life, things change and in the computer
industry they improve at an alarming rate. On a Monday you can buy a state
of the art CD Rom and by Friday something better has come out.

I mean 2-3 years for a game is a very long time. I love EQ just as much as
the next person (for now-hehe) but that won't stop me from looking around
when something better comes out :)
